name: places/ChIJFWtGP55ZwokRUoNXrEPdYmI

displayName.text: New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai

formattedAddress: 310 E 14th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 310 E 14th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
If I could give less stars I would. My first appt and the resident decided to not put through one of my prescriptions because the computer crashed and it would be a hassle. It was a back up prescription but still..
not to mention at my follow up I was told it was a 3-4 hour wait with an appointment. What’s the point of scheduling appointments if the timing is that off? Who there is that incompetent of scheduling a calendar that works? I had other appointments that day I had to leave without a follow up.

text.text:

originalText.text:
I got a eye surgery done. The doctor said to pick up my prescription from pharmacy at 338 E 23rd street. so that I don't get infection. They never sent the prescription in. I called a bunch of times the same day and the next day. They made promises that the prescription will be send to the pharmacy but Nothing. They said, we emailed the doctor and it will be done soon. Nothing. These people would rather you eye get infected that truly take care of it.

Let's simply call it BAD WORK ETHICS.

originalText.text: Absolutely nightmarish experience trying to even schedule an appt.  I think they have a team of operators operating as a fortress to keep you on hold at all costs until your spirit is broken and you give up. I was determined to stay on after the first person (the right person) picked up after 1 minute then sent me to the general operator after not listening to my request for an appt, who sent me to another operator, who sent me back to the first person, who put me on hold for 30 min, then dropped in to say hello after putting me on hold for another 30. For the love of god help.  Good thing I checked the reviews to see that the wait times go to 4 hours once you actually show up for an appt. Certified dumpster fire avoid at all costs.

originalText.text: New York Eye and Ear has become a disaster. I’ve been going to this hospital for 35 years but since Mt Sinai took over the management it has gone off a cliff. Wait times have tripled and the staff seems over worked. If they really cared about patients instead of making a dollar they would schedule visits appropriately. I waited almost 4 hours for my last regular “follow up” appointment. Makes me wonder if the operating room is as chaotic. My doctors are great but I’m seriously thinking of going elsewhere for eye care. Sad to see how far this historic great lady has fallen.

originalText.text: The worst place ever. We had a 9:00am appointment it is now 1:00 and the dr has not called us. when you ask the nurses how much longer they respond with one second. I have read reviews and all they do is reply  "all feedback helps" DO BETTER it's always the same issue clearly they dont care about feedback.
